column2: The first King of Powys and High King over sub-Roman Britain. A strong leader, but notorious for hiring the Saxons as foederati and allowing them to enter Britannia.
A King of the Caledoni who united the many tribes of the North against the Romans. A legend among the Picts - surrounded, yet never surrendering, preferring death to slavery.
The great King of Dumnonia and High King of Britannia. He was able to unite the Celtic kingdoms of southern Britain against their common enemy, the Anglo-Saxons.
King over the Old North and the last Roman 'Dux Brittanniarum', he was the progenitor of many of the ruling dynasties of Hen Ogledd collectively known as the Coeling.
An Imperial prince stationed in Britannia who successfully revolted to claim the purple, he is remembered as the ancestor of many kingly lines across southern Britannia.
The last governor of Maxima Cæsariensis who remained after the Roman withdrawal, he opposed Vortigern and his plans to settle the Saxons in Britain.
A former chieftain on the Pictish frontier, Cunedda and his tribesmen were settled in northern Wales to resist the Irish, where he would found the Kingdom of Gwynedd.
The first king to unite the Anglo-Saxons in Britain under a single banner and be recognized as Bretwalda over all Ænglaland.
The glorious restorer of the Western Roman Empire, who defeated the barbarian kingdoms and restored Western Europe to Imperial rule.
